member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.POSvcContract.CheckLOC(System.String[]@,Erp.Tablesets.POTableset@)
member.summary: Checks outstanding amounts to limit on APLOC (if applicable) This should be called before updating POHeader, PODetail,PORel, POMisc, or POHeadMisc If limit is exceeded a string is returned asking the user if they want to override. If Releases have distinct Due Date and LOC is marked as "Ship Complete", a string is returned asking the user if they want to continue.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.POSvcContract.CheckPONum(System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: Method to call when entering proposed PO Number. This method will return two output variables. One is a logical field to indicate if the PO number entered is existing or not. The other variable is for the error message in case the proposed PO number is invalid. Removed Return from the end of this procedure
member.param: Indicates if the proposed PO number is already existing.
Error message for the user to see.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.POSvcContract.chkPODatesChanges(System.String@,System.String,Erp.Tablesets.POTableset)
member.summary: SCR 142197 - New logic to let the user know which date fields chenged Checks to see if certain fields changed on the order header or order line. If they did, a question is presented to the user asking if these changes should carry over to the order lines and/or order releases. This method returns the text of the message to ask. When adding a header it is not necessary to call this method because there won't be any lines or releases to propogate the changes to. The user can answer yes or no, but processing doesn't stop based on the answer. The answer should be stored in the dataset in field OrderHed.UpdateDtlAndRelRecords.
member.param: Name of the view that is being modified.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.POSvcContract.PartStatusValidationMessages(System.String@,System.String@,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: The method is to be run on leave of the PartNum, Revision fields before the GetPartInfo or Update methods are run. This returns all the questions that need to be asked before a part can be changed.
member.param: The new PartNum if a substitute part is found, partNum will be the substitute part
Asks if the user wants to use a substitute part
Indicates other substitute parts besides the default exist

Type of message returned. if avail porel then message porel.poline porel.trantype. Values can be; "Question" (asking if they want to use the substitute part) "Warning" (Warns them that a part is onhold or runout). "Error" (Part in Inactive, or Onhold/Runout parts are not accepted in this case) . "Question" is asking if they want to use the substitute part.

member.summary: Contains comments about over all purchase order. These will be printed on the purchase order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.OrderHeld
member.summary: Indicates if an order is flagged as being "HELD" , this is primarily used as a visual indicator in receipt entry. It does not prevent receipts from being entered for this order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ShipToConName
member.summary: Ship to contact name. Prints on Purchase order form. Defaults from the CustCnt or VendCnt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ReadyToPrint
member.summary: Indicates if the PO can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.PrintAs
member.summary: N = New, C = Change Order

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ExchangeRate
member.summary: Exchange rate that will be used for this order. Defaults from CurrRate.CurrentRate. Conversion rates will be calculated as System Base = Foreign value * rate, Foreign value = system base * (1/rate). This is the dollar in foreign currency from the exchange rate tables in the newspapers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.LockRate
member.summary: Used with the currency module. When TRUE the currency rate can be changed by the user and cannot be changed by the system. This will also be the default for the invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ShipCountryNum
member.summary: Country part of address. This field is in sync with the Country field. Must be a valid entry in the Country table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.LogChanges
member.summary: This field indicates if the system should generate purchase order booking records. Booking tables are used to track changes to POheader.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ApprovedDate
member.summary: System date that the PO was approved. This only pertains to PO which exceeded the buyers limit and have been approved.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ApprovedBy
member.summary: The BuyerID that approved the PO. (See ApprovedDate for related info)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.Approve
member.summary: Inidicates if the PO is "ready" to be approved. This is checked when all the information is complete and is ready to be processed. When checked the system will test if PO has exceeded the buyers or system purchasing limit. (See ApprovalStatus for related info) When Approve = yes the PO cannot be maintained.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ApprovalStatus
member.summary: Indicates the approval status of the PO. Valid values are; U - Unsubmitted for Approval, P - Pending Approval, A - Approved, R - Rejected. Before a PO can be printed it must be approved. A PO is consider approved if it doesn't exceed the buyers limit or it has been approved by the approver.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderRow.ApprovedAmount
member.summary: An internally used field that represents the total amount of the PO (in base currency) captured the last time the po was approved/rejected. Note: this only pertains to PO that required approval in the first place otherwise it's zero. The limit checking process will compare PO amounts to the greater of the buyers limit or this amount. Basically, if the PO was already approved once for a specific amount then it should not require subsequent approval until that amount is exceeded. Note: This also contains the PO amount if it was rejected. In this case, the PO remains as rejected until they reduce the PO amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.OpenLine
member.summary: Indicates if this line item is Open/Closed. This is not directly maintainable by the user. Normally it gets set to "Closed" as a result of the receiving process. When there are no longer any open PORel records then the PODetail record is closed. This can also be closed when the user Voids the Order or PODetail record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.VoidLine
member.summary: Indicates if the Line was voided. Voided line items are not maintainable, can't "unvoid". This field is not directly maintainable. Instead the void function will be performed via a "Void Line" button. Which then presents a verification dialog box. When an PODetail record is 'voided', all current open PORel records are also closed and voided. If no other open PoDetail records exist then set the PoHeader.OperOrder = No. This can also be set when the related PoHeader is voided.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.PONUM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.POLine
member.summary: The line number of the detail record on the purchase order. This number uniquely identifies the record within the Purchase Order number. The number not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created. The user references this item during PO receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.LineDesc
member.summary: Defaults from JobOper, JobMtl or Part depending on the reference to the job records. If no job reference then uses the Part.PartDescription if it is a valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.UnitCost
member.summary: The unit price in the vendors unit of measure. Unfortunately the Field Name is UnitCost instead of UnitPrice which is a little misleading

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.DocUnitCost
member.summary: The unit price in the vendors unit of measure and currency. Unfortunately the Field Name is UnitCost instead of UnitPrice which is a little misleading.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.OrderQty
member.summary: Total Order Quantity for the line item. This is stored in the Vendors Unit of Measure. This quantity must always be kept in sync with the scheduled release quantities stored in the PORel table. Normally this field is directly maintainable. However when multiple shipping releases have been established for this line (more than one PORel record) the OrderQty is not maintainable. As the user modifies the quantities in the individual release lines the OrderQty field will get adjusted. This insures that Order quantity and scheduled quantities are always in sync.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.XOrderQty
member.summary: Total Order Quantity for the line item. This is stored in Our Unit of Measure. This quantity must always be kept in sync with the scheduled release quantities stored in the PORel table. Normally this field is directly maintainable. However when multiple shipping releases have been established for this line (more than one PORel record) the XOrderQty is not maintainable. As the user modifies the quantities in the individual release lines the XOrderQty field will get adjusted. This ensures that Order quantity and scheduled quantities are always in sync.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.PUM
member.summary: Purchasing UOM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.CostPerCode
member.summary: Indicates the costing per quantity. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Used to calculate the extended unit cost for the line item. The logic is to divide the PODetail.OrderQty by the appropriate "per" value and then multiply by unit cost. Use the Part.PricePerCode as a default. If Part record does not exist then default as "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PODetailRow.CostPerCodeContract
member.summary: Indicates the costing per quantity (When Contract PO). It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Used to calculate the extended unit cost for the line item. The logic is to divide the PODetail.OrderQty by the appropriate "per" value and then multiply by unit cost. Use the Part.PricePerCode as a default. If Part record does not exist then default as "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.OpenRelease
member.summary: Indicates if this release is open. This is normally closed via the receiving program. But can be changed indirectly by the user during order entry when they "Void" the release..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.VoidRelease
member.summary: Indicates if the release was voided. Voided releases items are not maintainable, can't "unvoid". This field is not directly maintainable. Instead the void function will be performed via a "Void Release" button. Which then presents a verification dialog box. When an PORel record is 'voided', PORel.OpenRelease is set to "no". If no other open PORel records exist for the related PODetail then the PoDetail.OpenLine is set to "No". If no other open PoDetail records exist then set the PoHeader.OperOrder = No. This can also be set when the related PoDetail or PoHeader is voided.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.PONum
member.summary: Purchase order that this release record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.POLine
member.summary: The line # of PODetail record that the PORel record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.PORelNum
member.summary: Purchase order release number uniquely identifies a purchase release requirement record for a specific line item on an order. This is assigned by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.DueDate
member.summary: Specifies the date by which you need to receive a release of a part. This date is taken from the Purchase Order Line Due Date, if its null, PORel.DueDate will take the value from POHeader.DueDate. If you're adding releases from: - BTO or Drop Shipments, PORel.DueDate will take the value from OrderRel.NeedByDate - Job Material , PORel.DueDate will take the value from JobMtl.ReqDate. - Subcontract Operations, PORel.DueDate wil take the value from JobOper.DueDate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.XRelQty
member.summary: Order quantity for this release in our unit of measure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.PurchasingFactor
member.summary: This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the vendors unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory or used in manufacturing. Example is purchased in pounds, stocked in sheets. When this field is not zero Purchase Order Entry calculates the Vendor order qty (RelQty) whenever the Order Qty in our U/M (XRelQty) is changed or Vice-Versa. Formula: XRelQty * Factor = RelQty

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.RelQty
member.summary: Order quantity for this release in vendors unit of measure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.JobNum
member.summary: This is populated for Purchase Direct items only and contains the job number for the purchased direct item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: This is populated for Purchase Direct items only and contains the assembly number for the purchased direct item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.JobSeqType
member.summary: Qualifies the JobSeq field as to be a "M" - Material (JobMtl) record or "S" - Subcontract (JobOper) reference. FYI: This field can indirectly sets the TranType field via the write trigger. It can itself be set from the TranType. System keeps them compatible. JobSeqType/TranType values are; M = PUR-MTL, S = PUR-SUB, " " = PUR-STK or PUR-UKN. This possibly could have been deleted. However we decided to keep it for backward compatablity reasons.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.JobSeq

member.summary: Indicates if the user overrode the default expense accounts for this release. This field prevents the program from resetting the account #'s when the user changes other fields that trigger new default accounts to be set. If "Yes" then the defaults will not be used.

If you're adding releases from: - BTO or Drop Shipments, PORel.PromiseDt will take the value from OrderRel.NeedByDate. - Job Material , PORel.DueDate will take the value from JobMtl.ReqDate. - Subcontract Operations, PORel.DueDate wil take the value from JobOper.DueDate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.LockRel

SEV, 11/21/02: New convention to indicate who is blocking new suggestions: the presence of "B" indicates the Buyer, and "V" indicates the Vendor. "BV" means both Buyer and Vendor want no changes in Date or Qty on this release.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PORelRow.TranType
member.summary: Indicates what the item is being purchased for. Items can be purchased for Job Material ("PUR-MTL"), Job Subcontract ("PUR-SUB"), Stock ("PUR-STK") or Other ("PUR-UKN"). JobSeqType/TranType values are; M =PUR-MTL, S = PUR-SUB, " " = PUR-STK or PUR-UKN.

This field is intended to be used for analysis purposes. When the value is changed from blank to non-blank or vice versa tax calculation logic kicks in to calculate the PO tax info.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderTaxRow.ReportableAmt
member.summary: The reportable sales amount to the tax jurisdiction. Set the value as follows; first determine if the item needs to be reported to the tax jurisdiction. This is done by using the APInvDtl.TaxCode and APInvDtl/APInvMisc.TaxCat to find a record in the SalesTxC. If a record is not found or SalesTxC.Reportable = Yes then add in the line item extended amount or if this is for a InvcMisc record InvcMisc.Amount. Manually entered if APInvTax.Manual = Yes else set equal to SysCalcReportableAmt.

member.summary: Indicates if the PO can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderListRow.ApprovedDate
member.summary: System date that the PO was approved. This only pertains to PO which exceeded the buyers limit and have been approved.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderListRow.ApprovedBy
member.summary: The BuyerID that approved the PO. (See ApprovedDate for related info)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderListRow.Approve
member.summary: Inidicates if the PO is "ready" to be approved. This is checked when all the information is complete and is ready to be processed. When checked the system will test if PO has exceeded the buyers or system purchasing limit. (See ApprovalStatus for related info) When Approve = yes the PO cannot be maintained.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.POHeaderListRow.ApprovalStatus
member.summary: Indicates the approval status of the PO. Valid values are; U - Unsubmitted for Approval, P - Pending Approval, A - Approved, R - Rejected. Before a PO can be printed it must be approved. A PO is consider approved if it doesn't exceed the buyers limit or it has been approved by the approver.
